19.name: Bomb Torizo Room

nodes.name: Climb Bottom Left Door (from Tourian Escape)
Climb Top Right Door (from Crateria Supers Top)
Climb Middle Right Door (to Crateria Supers Bottom)
Climb Bottom Right Door (to Pit Room)

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using scroll blocks a few tiles in front of the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks (Bottom Left to Top)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A long Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the top morph tunnel.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Blind Climb to the Top
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks next to the bomb wall
After passing through, you need to go from the bottom to the top of Climb and into the bomb blocks while still in G-mode Morph.
Samus will not be visible at all; the only available feedback is audio and position on the map.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks (Bottom Left to Bottom)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Blind
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks next to the bomb wall
Navigate to the lower right bomb blocks while still morphed.
Samus will be off-camera and not visible, requiring blind movement.
Enemies will not hurt Samus since they are non-global and also off-camera.

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks immediately in front of the bomb wall

strats.name: Zebes Ablaze
strats.devNote: These are destroyed on entry if Zebes is Ablaze.

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs immediately in front of the bomb blocks.
Reach the bottom and pass through the bomb blocks while still in G-mode.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs immediately in front of the bomb blocks.
Fall down to the lower bomb blocks while still in G-mode Morph.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: SpeedBall
strats.note: Mockball on the platform below the morphball tunnel and springball jump in while staying blue.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Fall down and pass through bomb wall at the bottom while still in G-mode.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 7 screens.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
If Morph is not available, careful movement is needed with SpringBall to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top (from Crateria Supers Bottom)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
A long series of precise bomb jumps and enemy manipulations are required to reach the top without taking a hit.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ with PBs
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Place PBs as high as possible to occasionally kill multiple pirates at a time.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks (Bottom Right to Top)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A long Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the top morph tunnel.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to any of the bomb blocks in the room, allowing passage through the bomb blocks at the top by making them become air.
If Morph is not available, careful movement is needed with SpringBall to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top (from Pit Room)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top
note: A long series of precise bomb jumps and enemy manipulations are required to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks at the top, allowing passage through them by making them become air.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ with PBs
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Place PBs as high as possible to occasionally kill multiple pirates at a time.
Overload the PLMs at the bottom, if the top bomb block is hit with a PB before PLMs are overloaded, they will remain solid.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks (Bottom Right to Bottom)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bottom right bomb blocks, allowing passage through them by making them become air.
If Morph is unavailable, then careful movement will be required to get past the Pirates without taking a hit.
If using a PB to kill the pirates, overload the PLMs at the bottom. If the top bomb block is hit with a PB before PLMs are overloaded, they will remain solid.

strats.name: Zebes Ablaze
strats.devNote: These are destroyed on entry if Zebes is Ablaze.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Top
strats.note: Starting with a crouch, diagonal shinespark to the top to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks to Top
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A long Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the top morph tunnel.
strats.devNote: The runway was reduced by 0.5 tiles, as you can't maintain Temporary Blue directly against a wall.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Climb Moonfall Block Break
note: The bomb blocks can be broken by spinjumping with Screw attack and holding right, if moonfall makes Samus clip through the platform.
Use the small blue platform 2nd from the top on the right side.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks to Bottom
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.
strats.devNote: The runway was reduced by 0.5 tiles, as you can't maintain Temporary Blue directly against a wall.

strats.name: Space Pirate Farm
devNote: The Space Pirates (wall) drop Supers and Power Bombs each at a 0.4% rate, too low to put into logic.
FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

nodes.name: Crateria Power Bomb Room Door (to Landing Site)

strats.name: Alcoon Farm
note: The Alcoons have a 99.5% Power Bomb drop rate, after which they only drop small energy.
devNote: The energy dropped is too low even for a very patient strat, considering worst-case scenarios such as a neighboring heated room, no beams, and the possible need to refill several tanks worth of energy.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Duck under the first two Alcoon shots, or retreat back a platform to fight them with Power Beam.
strats.devNote: All the Alcoons are assumed killed in each case.

nodes.name: Crateria Super Room Top Left Door (to Climb Top)
Crateria Super Room Bottom Left Door (to Climb Middle)
Crateria Super Room Junction (Right of Spikes)
Crateria Super Room Junction (Right of Boyons)

strats.name: X-Mode BlueSuit
note: Enter with a shinespark ready, activate XMode by bouncing into the spikes, then activate the shinespark but release XMode during the shinespark windup animation.
devNote: FIXME: This strat can visit 3 and pass the Boyons without additional health cost.
FIXME: A Spikesuit can be gained using XMode, and that can be converted to a blue suit with another use of XMode but attempting to will lose the spikesuit.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph and Bombs to overload Speed Blocks
strats.devNote: The IBJ strat has 2 extra spike hits added as a leniency.

strats.name: G-Mode and Grapple to overload Grapple Blocks
strats.note: Quickly grapple to then release grapple on the grapple blocks a few times until they stop working. Be careful not to fall into the spikes.
strats.devNote: Grapple cannot be used to get over the spikes, as the PLMs are overloaded too quickly.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs by PBing Super Item
strats.note: Place the PBs very close to the item in order to minimize the number needed. Be sure not to touch the item if this strat will be needed again in the future.
devNote: Can be done with 3 PBs, but it requires getting extremely close to the item.
FIXME Add strat for going down without PBs, by using the uncollected item to overload PLMs. This can only be done once, as it forces item pickup.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 7 screens.

strats.name: Frozen Boyon Runway and Fast Walljumps
note: Quickly Walljump to conserve health on the shinespark.

strats.name: Frozen Boyon Runway and HiJump
note: Use an extra speedy jump or walljump to conserve health on the shinespark.

strats.name: Dead Boyon Quick Charge
note: This is doable without a short charge, but it's essentially harder than the bluesuit jump.
With a quick charge, it can serve as a less scary strat.

strats.name: Crateria Supers BlueSuit Jump
strats.note: Involves charging a spark running left, then getting blue suit running right to jump through the Boyons.

strats.name: Crateria Supers G-Mode Up with PBs
strats.note: Wall jump up 9 times, placing a PB at the top. Only works in direct g-mode with the item still uncollected.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Using this strat won't risk canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess if the player could x-ray climb instead. However if the adjacent room is heated and Samus is really low energy, this could be a problem.

strats.name: Crateria Supers G-Mode Morph Long Ceiling Bomb Jump
note: Ascend with a long IBJ, then ceiling bomb jump against the speed blocks to overload the PLMs. Falling is very unforgiving.
Note that the boyons can be killed with bombs.
strats.devNote: This is technically doable without canBePatient, but would require double bomb jump, morph, a way to bypass Boyons, and never falling.

strats.name: Take Boyon Damage
strats.note: Take damage before attempting to jump through to avoid falling in the acid.

strats.name: Screw Attack
strats.note: Jump at the last tile to make it through all of the Boyons.

strats.name: Take Boyon Damage
strats.note: Take damage before attempting to jump through to avoid falling in the acid.

strats.name: Screw Attack
strats.note: Jump at the last tile to make it through all of the Boyons.

nodes.name: Crateria Tube Left Doorway (to Landing Site)
Final Missile Bombway Left Door (to Final Missile)
Final Missile Bombway Right Door (to Parlor)

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Bombs
strats.note: Repeatedly bomb the crumble blocks until the PLMs are overloaded.

nodes.name: Landing Site Top Left Door (to Gauntlet)
Landing Site Bottom Left Door (to Parlor)
Landing Site Top Right Door (to Power Bombs)
Landing Site Bottom Right Door (to Crateria Tube)
Ship
nodes.devNote: FIXME If there's a proper memory address to the ship/elevator it was in hiding

nodes.name: Escape Zebes
nodes.devNote: Not a normal elevator so no nodeaddresses to or from here

nodes.name: Landing Site Junction (Gauntlet Ledge)
nodes.note: Represents the ledge on the way to gauntlet, but on the right side of the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (Ship)
nodes.note: Represents being at the Ship with G-Mode Morph (artificial morph)

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload the scroll PLMs which are one tile to the left of the bomb blocks leading to Gauntlet.
Then pass through the bomb blocks (which will have become air).
If needed, continue on through the next set of bomb blocks (which will also be air) to reach the bottom right door.
devNote: FIXME: add something to indicate we can refill at the Ship on the way (e.g. if we add a logical requirement type for this).
This only affects the logic in the case where we can't walljump or get over the top in some other way.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload the scroll PLMs which are one tile to the left of the bomb blocks leading to Gauntlet.
Then pass through the bomb blocks (which will have become air).
devNote: Other items (SpringBall or Power Bombs) could be used to get through but these cases are not relevant, as Bombs are needed to do anything useful with G-Mode Morph after this point.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Top)
note: This strat is fairly precise. All jumps should be as small as possible.
Using at least one-tap short charge, jump off the ledge and descend as much as possible while keeping space jump active.
Once approaching the wall, be sure to jump again to continue through all of the bomb blocks.
If HiJump is available, it is much easier to use the blue space jump strat from the ground.
strats.devNote: Although there is a larger runway available, minimizing the speed is important.

strats.name: Landing Site Big Jump Blue Suit Bounce
note: With the door closed, run the full upper runway and jump at the end.
Morph after bumping the top of the sky to bounce through the bomb blocks to the Gauntlet.

strats.name: Big Jump Midair Shinespark
note: Store the spark on the right side of the ledge.  Run left and do a big jump towards the gauntlet door and then midair spark at the right time.
The lines in the background make for a good way to measure height.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Mid)
strats.note: Use the lines in the background to determine the height of the breakable blocks.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Bottom)
note: Starting near the right runway, run through the bomb block passage, then jump right after exiting.
Using HiJump and space jump, Samus is able to elevate enough to break through the bomb blocks blocking the Gauntlet entrance.

strats.name: SpeedyJump Into SpringballJump
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: HiJump
strats.devNote: HiJump alone can only reach the lower bomb block.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This is for sparking from 5 -> 1.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
note: Using IBJ to reach the Gauntlet entrance bomb blocks, place a Power Bomb and it will hit but not break the blocks.
After unmorphing and using X-Ray to cancel G-mode, the blocks will be broken, allowing Samus to pass through.

nodes.name: Parlor Bottom Left Door (to Final Missile Bombway)
Parlor Top Right Door (to Landing Site)

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks into Save
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the Terminator bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
Go down to the Save door by falling and moving back and forth in the right places.
Once you start going down you will be off-screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks into Alcatraz
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
Use Bombs, SpringBall, or a Geemer damage boost to get across the gap without unmorphing.
To survive a Geemer hit, you will need Varia or Gravity or to come in with more than 4 energy (e.g. by coming in with indirect G-mode after leaving with G-mode immobile).

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Left)
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Save)
note: Use G-Mode Morph to pass through the tunnel as you enter the room.
Then unmorph and get up to the top of the room normally.
There are scroll PLMs at the two-tile gap as you approach the Terminator bomb blocks, which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz (from Save)
note: Use G-Mode Morph to pass through the tunnel as you enter the room.
Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate to Alcatraz without unmorphing.

strats.name: Parlor X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This is a short climb of only a few tiles.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save (from Landing Site)
note: A single Power Bomb, placed precisely and as early as possible, can get you over the Geemers and onto the ledge above Alcatraz without taking a hit.
Alternatively Bombs or SpringBall can be used.
Go down to the Save door by just falling and moving back and forth in the right places.
Once you start going down you will be off-screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz (from Landing Site)
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the right of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs, turning the bomb blocks to air.
However, if Zebes is awake, two Geemers block the way.
With a regular G-mode setup and no suits, a single Geemer hit would kill Samus.
The Geemer hits can be avoided with Bombs or SpringBall.

Alternatively, a Power Bomb, placed precisely and as early as possible, can be used to jump onto the ledge and go around to the left entrance to Alcatraz (necessary since the Power Bomb blast will render the bomb blocks solid, unable to be turned to air).
A Geemer hit can also be tanked by having Varia or Gravity or by coming in with higher energy (e.g. with G-mode immobile).

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Blocks (from Alcatraz)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
You will need to briefly navigate off-screen while to the right of Alcatraz before coming back left.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Parlor Save Morph Tunnel (from Alcatraz)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
You will need to briefly navigate off-screen while to the right of Alcatraz before coming back left, and while going down the left shaft.

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape
strats.note: Wall jump up and midair morph to get out without needing to break the bomb blocks to the right.

strats.name: Frozen Geemer Alcatraz Escape
note: Wait 3 minutes for a global Geemer to waddle over, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Freeze the Geemer as it turns onto the middle slope of the left wall to escape - it helps to freeze the geemer from below.
Alternatively, use a Super to knock it off the wall and freeze it mid-air.
strats.devNote: This is only really useful without wall jumps.

strats.name: Ceiling Clip Alcatraz Escape
note: Wait for a global geemer to make the long trip along the map.
Freeze it just after it starts climbing the bomb blocks.
Then use Xray to standup before jumping through the ceiling.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Alcatraz Escape
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: Parlor Shinespark
strats.note: Shinespark at least from just above the left side morph tunnel.

strats.name: Maintain Speedbooster
strats.note: Maintain the blue state from SpeedBooster across the top of the room to break the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Right)
note: There are scroll PLMs throughout the room, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save (from Central Junction)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz (from Central Junction)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: Geemer Farm
strats.devNote: FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: Temporary Blue
strats.note: Breaking the side blocks can be done with a shinespark, or by moving into them once past the solid blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
When the bomb blocks turn to air, lay bombs as Samus falls.
After landing on the first platform, quickly unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode before the bombs explode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: As soon as you enter the room, lay a Power Bomb to break the bomb blocks leading down to the item.
After the Pirate is destroyed, move to the right to a location safe from the path of the lasers.
Then unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode, which will clear the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Through the Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
Using X-Ray to cancel G-mode will lead to a soft lock if the item there can't be used to get Samus out.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Be careful not to touch any of the pirates or their spawned lasers. It may be worthwhile to drop into the pit until the wall pirate is in a good position.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
When the bomb blocks turn to air, lay bombs as Samus falls.
After landing on the first platform, quickly unmorph and use X-Ray to cancel G-mode before the bombs explode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Be careful not to touch any of the pirates or their spawned lasers.
Use Power Bomb horizontal boosts to move toward the left side of the room in artificial morph.
Roll off the third blue platform from the right door and lay a Power Bomb against the left wall to get into range of the bomb blocks.
Unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode. It may be best to do this before the PB explodes, in case PLMs are already overloaded.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Spring Ball to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Be careful not to touch any of the pirates or their spawned lasers. It may be worthwhile to drop into the pit until the wall pirate is in a good position.
Use SpringBall to go under the Pirates and reach the left side of the room in artificial morph.
Use a Power Bomb to break the bomb blocks.
Unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode, which will clear the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Through the Bomb Blocks
note: Be careful not to touch any of the pirates spawned lasers.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
Using X-Ray to cancel G-mode will lead to a soft lock if the item there can't be used to get Samus out.

nodes.name: Final Missile Door (to Final Missile Bombway)
